item.title: How do i do this?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“ianternet, post:8, topic:70997”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=104314.msg1050638#msg1050638 date=1174855595]
No, the writePlayers(); is in the right place, I think he just replaced the wrong things. You need to replace this import java.io.*; import java.util.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar; import java.security.*; with this import java.io.*; import java.util.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar; [b]import java.text.*;[/b] import java.security.*; Nothing else.
[/quote]
wont this make what i already had[/quote]Are you blind or something?

Read full topic

item.title: How do i do this?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

  1. Open client.java
  2. Replace the stuff at the top with this:

import java.io.*; import java.util.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar; import java.text.*; import java.security.*;
3. Add this method:

public void writePlayers() { SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("MMM dd hh:mm"); String date = sdf.format(new Date()); int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126(" ", 13589); sendFrame126(" ", 13590); sendFrame126("serverNameHere", 13591); sendFrame126("@red@Players Online: @whi@"+players, 13592); sendFrame126("@whi@"+date, 13593); sendFrame126(" ", 13594); sendFrame126(" ", 13595); sendFrame126(" ", 13596); sendFrame126(" ", 13597); sendFrame126(" ", 13598); sendFrame126(" ", 13599); sendFrame126(" ", 13600); setInterfaceWalkable(13588); }
4. CTRL + F, type in ‘public boolean process() {’
5. Under the opening Bracket ‘{’ put

writePlayers();

Save + Compile your done.

Read full topic
